body_content.explanation: a kind of agave (= a plant with thick leaves that grows in hot, dry parts of the the southern US and in South America) with sweet-smelling white flowers that are used to make perfume (= a liquid with a pleasant smell used on the skin) :
examples: The tuberose has been prized for centuries for its intensely fragrant white flowers.
Enormous vases held displays of flowers: lilies, white lilac, and tuberoses.
The perfume is an old-fashioned combination of jasmine, Bulgarian rose, narcissus and tuberose.
